subs.text: @WattsHarry3 Oh, you must not know then. There aren’t enough trails and (safe) bike lanes in Toronto. The popularity of #ActiveTO shows that. Let me know if you need some resources on what needs to be done in Toronto. Follow #BikeTO hashtag, that’s a good start.
subs.rawText: @WattsHarry3 Oh, you must not know then. There aren’t enough trails and (safe) bike lanes in Toronto. The popularity of #ActiveTO shows that. Let me know if you need some resources on what needs to be done in Toronto. Follow #BikeTO hashtag, that’s a good start.

subs.text: @WattsHarry3 No benefit? Another weird lie. What’s up with all the lying?
subs.rawText: @WattsHarry3 No benefit? Another weird lie. What’s up with all the lying?

subs.text: @WattsHarry3 Actually, I think you’re wrong about that one. If I recall correctly, on that day, I don’t think it was as busy as it was normally. The weather wasn’t so great that day. Maybe you recall differently. We’re you there that day? I was.
subs.rawText: @WattsHarry3 Actually, I think you’re wrong about that one. If I recall correctly, on that day, I don’t think it was as busy as it was normally. The weather wasn’t so great that day. Maybe you recall differently. We’re you there that day? I was.

subs.text: @WattsHarry3 I admit, I too was shocked when I learned that #ActiveTO was 0.02% of the City of Toronto’s operating budget. [link]

subs.text: @WattsHarry3 More than one person, I’m pretty sure you meant. I appreciate you looking at how many people used it and enjoyed it, as you can see in the many photos and videos. Thanks for coming sound on this.
subs.rawText: @WattsHarry3 More than one person, I’m pretty sure you meant. I appreciate you looking at how many people used it and enjoyed it, as you can see in the many photos and videos. Thanks for coming sound on this.

subs.text: @WattsHarry3 Literally no one using it? How can you lie like that? I was just there and there was minimum one person (me) plus I saw other people there too. So that’s wrong. What else are you wrong about? Who else do you lie to?

subs.text: May 28

@adamrg Probably because it’s a coming-of-age series, and I don’t remember much of my childhood. Nothing traumatic, it just seems zapped from my memory, my theory being it’s from having spent so much time in front of a computer monitor. It doesn’t hit any nostalgia buttons.
subs.rawText: @adamrg Probably because it’s a coming-of-age series, and I don’t remember much of my childhood. Nothing traumatic, it just seems zapped from my memory, my theory being it’s from having spent so much time in front of a computer monitor. It doesn’t hit any nostalgia buttons.

subs.text: @adamrg Reading about it, more like it. I stopped watching after the second season.
subs.rawText: @adamrg Reading about it, more like it. I stopped watching after the second season.

subs.text: @goodreads I can only listen to music without lyrics while reading. Otherwise it’s too distracting. The exception is when it’s a book *about* music, such as Dilla Time by @dancharnas, where I want to hear the artist’s music (and music adjacent to the artist) that’s the subject of the book.
subs.rawText: @goodreads I can only listen to music without lyrics while reading. Otherwise it’s too distracting. The exception is when it’s a book *about* music, such as Dilla Time by @dancharnas, where I want to hear the artist’s music (and music adjacent to the artist) that’s the subject of the book.

subs.text: Today is a planned mental health day, and I hoped to go to Toronto Islands to have time slow down a bit. Rainy weather let me off the hook for the poor planning I did for that. Plan B was to get closer to a sense of being on top of things around my apartment, and so far so good.
subs.rawText: Today is a planned mental health day, and I hoped to go to Toronto Islands to have time slow down a bit. Rainy weather let me off the hook for the poor planning I did for that. Plan B was to get closer to a sense of being on top of things around my apartment, and so far so good.

subs.text: I sometimes want to ask people and their friends who don’t wear a mandatory face covering on the TTC “What are the odds that all of you have the same medical condition preventing you from wearing a mask?” Then I remember that I’m trying to avoid getting punched in the face.
subs.rawText: I sometimes want to ask people and their friends who don’t wear a mandatory face covering on the TTC “What are the odds that all of you have the same medical condition preventing you from wearing a mask?” Then I remember that I’m trying to avoid getting punched in the face.

subs.text: For the first time, I selected “MOST ARE NOT” (it also bugs me that it’s a streetcar I was on, not a train). [link]
subs.rawText: For the first time, I selected “MOST ARE NOT” (it also bugs me that it’s a streetcar I was on, not a train). https://t.co/3HX8XmJh87

subs.text: I know intellectually that you can’t tell if someone is an asshole just by looking at them, but why is it that everybody who doesn’t wear a mask on the TTC when it’s mandatory to do so also happens to look like an asshole?
subs.rawText: I know intellectually that you can’t tell if someone is an asshole just by looking at them, but why is it that everybody who doesn’t wear a mask on the TTC when it’s mandatory to do so also happens to look like an asshole?

subs.text: Those who don’t wear a mask on the TTC (it’s still mandatory to do so) often transgress in other ways as well. Like the guy who didn’t let people off first (he did that on purpose, he told a friend) or the ones that don’t appear to pay fare. Maybe they have a transfer?
subs.rawText: Those who don’t wear a mask on the TTC (it’s still mandatory to do so) often transgress in other ways as well. Like the guy who didn’t let people off first (he did that on purpose, he told a friend) or the ones that don’t appear to pay fare. Maybe they have a transfer?

subs.text:
Perfect night at the ballpark. Star Wars + baseball combines two of my favourite things, and one of my crushes complimented me on my Baby Yoda enamel pin, which I wore on my hat (inspired move, that one). 

But don’t worry, I didn’t tell her.
